title: Organic Valley Welcomes Jeff Frank As New Chief Executive Officer - PR Newswire
summary: Organic Valley is a leading organic farmer-owned cooperative on a mission to save, serve, and safeguard small organic family farms. Jeff Frank has been named the new CEO, replacing Bob Kirchoff who is retiring. Frank has a strong track record in the food industry and is committed to the cooperative's values.

title: New Vegan Tuna and Salmon Roll Out at Whole Foods Sushi Counters - VegNews
summary: Kikka Sushi, a partner of Whole Foods for over 30 years, has expanded its sushi selection to include plant-based tuna and salmon made from a proprietary blend of red algae and konjac. Kikka's new plant-based sushi is just the beginning for the brand's exploration of fish-free innovations, which also include plant-based gyoza, hot bowls, and poke. A number of other companies are also developing realistic alternatives to sushi-grade fish, such as Current Foods, GTFO It's Vegan, and Aqua Cultured Foods.
green_innovation: TRUE, Kikka Sushi's plant-based tuna and salmon are green innovations because they contribute to environmental sustainability goals by reducing the demand for fish and protecting marine ecosystems.
business_innovation: TRUE, Kikka Sushi's plant-based tuna and salmon are business innovations because they are new or improved products that differ significantly from the firm's previous products and have been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE, Kikka Sushi's plant-based tuna and salmon are green products because they are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: FALSE, the article does not describe a green process.

title: Lallemand's probiotic authorized in the EU as a technological additive for all animal species - Aquafeed.com
summary: The European Union has authorized the use of Pediococcus acidilactici CNCM I-4622 (BACTOCELL) as a technological feed additive to reduce pH and limit the growth of coliform bacteria in liquid feeds. This is the first lactic acid bacteria to receive authorization related to the hygiene of liquid feed. BACTOCELL is produced by Lallemand Animal Nutrition.
green_innovation: TRUE, BACTOCELL is a green innovation because it contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing the growth of harmful bacteria in liquid feeds, thereby improving the hygiene and safety of animal feed.
business_innovation: TRUE, BACTOCELL is a business innovation because it is a new product that is significantly different from Lallemand Animal Nutrition's previous products and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE, BACTOCELL is a green product because it is designed to reduce the environmental impact of liquid feeds by reducing the growth of harmful bacteria.
green_process: FALSE, the article does not describe a green process.
likely_naics_codes: ['311119: Other Animal Food Manufacturing', '325411: Medicinal and Botanical Manufacturing', '541990: All Other Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services', '561990: All Other Support Services']
greenwashing: FALSE, BACTOCELL is not an example of greenwashing because it has been authorized by the European Food Safety Authority for its safety and potential to reduce pH and limit the growth of coliform bacteria in liquid feeds.

title: IPPE 2023 launch: Phileo Lesaffre targets poultry production with yeast probiotic - FeedNavigator.com
summary: Phileo Lesaffre claims its new probiotic, Actisaf Sc 47 HR+, delivers a range of benefits for poultry, including improved gut microbiota diversity and function, better feed use efficiency, and higher body weights. Several trials have shown the product's efficacy, including a peer-reviewed study conducted by He et al. and a field trial carried out on a broiler farm in Eastern Europe in 2022. The product is said to be heat-resistant and does not require foreign material coating.

title: Serenity Kids Reinvents Smoothies with the Launch of the First Ever Low Sugar, Dairy-Free Smoothies with Grass Fed ... - PR Newswire
summary: Serenity Kids, a leading shelf-stable baby and toddler food brand, has launched a new line of Dairy-Free Smoothie + Protein pouches. These pouches are the first-ever baby food products to include protein from grass-fed collagen. They are also low in sugar, contain no added sugar, and are packed with nutrition from organic vegetables, herbs, and spices.

green_process: FALSE, The article does not describe any new process, but instead a new product.

title: Flipkart Launches ‘Flipkart Green’ for Customers Looking to Adopt a Sustainable Lifestyle - Indian Retailer
summary: Juicy Chemistry and Mommy Shots by Amrita have joined forces to launch the 'Scars are Beautiful' campaign in honor of Women's Day, featuring 11 mothers proudly displaying their postpartum bodies and stretch marks to inspire other women to embrace their bodies and change societal perceptions. The campaign aims to promote self-love, body positivity, and inclusivity, and to challenge the unrealistic beauty standards often portrayed in the media. Through powerful storytelling and imagery, the campaign celebrates the strength and resilience of mothers and encourages women to embrace their unique journeys and the beauty of their bodies.
